awd_titl_txt: SBIR Phase I:  Scalable, on-demand, research-based, help-seeking innovation for learners in virtual and recorded training programs
awd_abstract_narration:
The broader impact/commercial potential of this Small Business Innovation Research (SBIR) Phase I project is to develop a scalable, on-demand, research-based innovation for learners in virtual and recorded training programs. Research has shown that underrepresented populations arrive at an undergraduate institution less likely to have the advanced study skills or confident awareness to seek assistance when faced with uncertainty in the classroom. This project provides on-demand responses to in-lesson queries and helps develop deep study skills. Additionally, for the students who arrive at college without sufficient familial or academic support, the proposed product becomes a resource to participate successfully in an undergraduate environment. 

This Small Business Innovation Research (SBIR) Phase I project will build an engine that automatically identifies the discipline of a course based on the extracted words and phrases spoken or visually presented in class, and then will identify terms important to the learning objectives of the course, garnered via categorical arrays of discipline specific keywords. Automatic creation of personalized study guides is initiated based on the learners' individual queries or class discussions. This innovation is applicable to the remote learning industries, where it may increase the value of their customers’ online content and enable teaching professionals to strive for higher levels of equity in the student population.

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Technology, Innovation, and Partnerships

por.por_cntn:
In today’s fast-paced world, where education is the key to unlocking doors to brighter futures, many find themselves challenged by time constraints. Others, particularly those with special needs, face difficulties focusing their study time. Rising costs and the whirlwind of daily life often rise as barriers too high for many college-age and adult learners. At LearningClues, we have seen these challenges not just as hurdles but as a call to action—a problem awaiting a solution.

We embarked on a mission to streamline the educational experience, to shape it into something that fits into the cramped spaces of a busy schedule, and to tailor it to the unique needs of every learner, including those with special requirements. We envisioned a world where the pressing commitments of family, work, and other responsibilities no longer strip away the opportunity to learn and grow.

Our Small Business Innovation Research Phase I project has borne fruit in the form of a suite of applications, designed for college students and working adults alike. The centerpiece of our innovation is a search tool, a technological marvel that functions much like a fast-forward button to the pivotal moments of educational videos. This tool has shown to shave minutes off study sessions. Students at the University of Michigan were among the first to experience this transformation, as it was integrated into the campus Learning Management System (see Figure 1). No longer do they need to sift through hours of video footage from their courses; with a few keystrokes, they can now zoom in on the essence of their lectures, saving precious time for reflection on specific aspects of the course content.

But why stop there? LearningClues has dared to dream bigger, and thus StudyClues was born. It is a virtual teaching assistant, understanding and responsive, a companion to the curious and the questioning. Crafted with the power of generative AI, StudyClues provides answers that are not only accurate but also embedded with links to the source material used to construct the response, just a click away (see Figure 2). For students with special needs, who require precise and tailored information, it has become not just an aid; it is a bridge to self-sufficiency and empowerment. For students with limited time, it offers a path to identify topics essential to course success.

The impact of our system extends beyond the conventional. It reaches out to those bound by time, to those who are differently-abled, offering them a chance not just to learn but to excel on their own terms. The StudyClues application supplies answers to learners' questions that are constructed using only the material presented or made available in the course. LearningClues supports the learning needs of all students, regardless of their time or special needs challenges, with the ability to dig beyond an answer to the specific course material used to construct the answer.


Last Modified: 02/13/2024
Modified by: Deborah M Samson
